types.html:
pleux

  1. (rare) inflection of pleuvoir:
    1. first/second-person singular present indicative
    2. second-person singular imperative
    • 1836, Mrs. Jamieson, A Topographical, Statistical And Domestic History Of France‎[1], page 377:
      Une croix, près de là, sur un tertre placée,
      De pleux souvenirs entretient la pensée
      A cross, close to there, on a mound placed
      Some raining memories maintain the thought(please verify) [Term?]
    • 2024, Clemix, “Je pleux”, in Endorphine‎[2]:
      Je pleux après mes premiers pas
      Je pleux sur mon nouveau vélo
      Je pleux à douze ans en solo
      I cry after my first steps
      I cry on my new bike
      I cry alone at twelve years-old

Usage notes

[edit]
  • Almost always used in a figurative sense.

title: pleux
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /plø/
